intro: Karroochloa, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are adapted to conserve water in hot, dry environments. Its bulbs store moisture and nutrients, allowing it to survive in harsh desert conditions. Karroochloa blooms typically in spring and early summer, adding a striking visual element to its native habitat.
